metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1201 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Privoxy before 3.0.22 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (file descriptor consumption) via unspecified vectors.  NOTE: the provenance of this information is unknown; the details are obtained solely from third party information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

privoxy - 3.0.24-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: debian> NOT-FOR-US: Bogus entry for Privoxy picked from Secunia

criterions.comment: privoxy package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.24-1').
